meanings.sent1: His constant teasing was incensing her.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party was incensing the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel incensed the dog by stealing its treats.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment incensed her like a storm brewing inside.
meanings.sent5: The rude comments were incensing her to the point of boiling over.

meanings.definition: Perfume with incense or a similar fragrance.
meanings.sent1: She was incensing the room with a calming lavender scent.
meanings.sent2: The priest was incensing the church during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The chef incensed the kitchen with the aroma of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent4: The garden was incensed with the sweet smell of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The air was incensing with the delightful scent of pine trees.
